channel.title: mldlaiip on sangeet259
channel.description: Recent content in mldlaiip on sangeet259

item.title: Categorical Cross Entropy vs Sparse Categorical Cross Entropy
item.description: I was looking for a loss function when browsing through Keras documentation I found two loss functions. The first one categorical_cross_entropy was familiar, however I saw something I had never used before it was sparsed_categorical_cross_entropy. The difference : Depends on the structure of your targets ! If your targets are one-hot encoded, you have to use categorical_crossentropy. Examples of one-hot encoding: [1,0,0] [0,1,0] [0,0,1] But if your targets are integers, use sparse_categorical_crossentropy.

item.title: Trying out Eager Execution
item.description: So there was a Data Science competition and after a long long time, I was doing something in Deep Learning. I was looking at colab when I saw this term “Eager Execution” popping up. So there I was trying to figure out what it was. Here in this article I try to summarise what I learnt from various sources. What it is? It’s a new imperative. The pythonic way of using tensorflow.

item.title: Accessing Files in Colab
item.description: To access your Google Drive files in Colab. You first need to mount it in your notebook. Here’s how to do that: from google.colab import drive drive.mount('/content/drive') After this you would be asked for authorisation and provided with a token, copy and paste that token back to mount your notebook at /content/drive/ My Drive. From this point onward you can use cd and ls to explore your drive and go where the data is.

item.title: Matplotlib Backened change during Training a DL Model
item.description: Matplotlib Backened change during Training a DL Model If you are training something on remote server where you dont have root access and get an error like your python is not configured for tkinter. This is nothing but maybe somewhere in your pipe Then you’re options are : First install tkinter, note that since you do not have sudo priviledge, you have to install tcl8.6-dev and tk8.6-dev from source too.

item.title: Setting Up OpenCV
item.description: I was trying to use the Tensorflow’s newly released Object Detection API on my webcam. I realised I couldn’t open webcam, OpenCV which was bundled with ROS was throwing all sorts of errors, I Googled and tried many hacky solution but all in vain. Now that my end sems were over I decided to install it fresh. This site : https://www.learnopencv.com/install-opencv3-on-ubuntu/ is a great walktrough through the installation process. It’s absolutely complete.
